title: 103_hr146
content: The "Privatization of Art Act of 1991" terminates the National Endowment for the Arts by repealing sections 5 and 6 of the National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act of 1965. The National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act of 1965 is amended to remove references to "the arts" in various paragraphs. Additionally, definitions in the Act are revised to eliminate certain subsections and clarify the role of the National Council on the Arts. The National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act of 1965 is amended to remove references to "the arts" in various paragraphs and revise definitions to clarify the role of the National Council on the Arts. Subsections are redesignated to streamline the Act. The National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act of 1965 is amended to remove references to "the arts" in various paragraphs and revise definitions to clarify the role of the National Council on the Arts. Subsections are redesignated to streamline the Act. The National Endowment for the Arts is amended to remove references to "the arts" in subsection (c) and administrative functions in subsection (e) of the National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act of 1965. The National Endowment for the Arts is amended to remove references to "the arts" and administrative functions in subsection (e) of the National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act of 1965. This includes striking specific language related to the Chairperson of the National Endowment for the Arts and defining duties in paragraph (3). The National Endowment for the Arts is amended by removing references to administrative functions and defining duties of the Chairperson. This includes revisions to specific language in various sentences. The National Endowment for the Arts is amended by revising language related to the Chairperson's duties, including removing specific references in subsections (b), (c), and (d). In subsection (e), amendments are made to paragraph (1) by removing references to the Chairperson of the National Endowment for the Arts and the requirement for joint action. In subsection (e), amendments are made to paragraph (1) by removing references to the Chairperson of the National Endowment for the Arts and the requirement for joint action. Amendments include striking references to "jointly", "arts education and", "arts and", and "Endowments" to "Endowment". In subsection (e), amendments are made to paragraph (1) by removing references to the Chairperson of the National Endowment for the Arts and the requirement for joint action. Amendments include striking references to "jointly", "arts education and", "arts and", and "Endowments" to "Endowment". Additionally, in subsection (f), changes involve removing references to "National Endowment for the Arts and the" and "arts education". SEC. 4. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Section 11 of the National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act of 1965 is amended to remove certain subparagraphs and redesignate clauses within subsection (a). Section 11 of the National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act of 1965 is amended by removing certain subparagraphs and redesignating clauses within subsections. This includes changes such as striking specific references and paragraphs in subsections (a)(4), (c), and (d). SEC. 5. SHORT TITLE. Amends the National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act of 1965 by removing references to "the Arts and". SEC. 6. TRANSITION PROVISIONS. On the effective date of the amendments made by this Act, property donated to the National Endowment for the Arts will be transferred to the National Endowment for the Humanities. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget will oversee the termination of operations for the National Endowment for the Arts and the National Council on the Arts, including the transfer or disposition of personnel, assets, liabilities, grants, contracts, and funds. The Act will take effect on the date of its enactment, with specific amendments becoming effective at the start of the first fiscal year after enactment.
